description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "Obamacare adds trillions to our deficits and to our national debt."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Obama "said (the individual mandate) wasn't a tax."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in comments on his radio show:
quote_txt: "Obamacare is . . . the largest tax increase in the history of the world."

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Senate rival Tommy Thompson said he wants to "do away with Medicare."

description_txt: stated on May 14, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: "There is little if any evidence that the use of red light cameras in New Jersey has reduced the number or severity of accidents at the intersections where they are used."

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2012 in a campaign speech:
quote_txt: "Over the last few decades, the income of the top 1 percent grew by more than 275 percent -- to an average of $1.3 million a year."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2012 in in a press statement:
quote_txt: Says "TriMet's own analysis shows that YouthPass does not actually add to the transit agency's costs."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2012 in a radio interview.:
quote_txt: Says the Constitution "specifically states the Congress shall write legislation for immigration policy," so Barack Obama lacks the authority to defer the deportation of young illegal immigrants.

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2012 in her speech at Texas Democratic Party State Convention in Houston:
quote_txt: Says because of Texas lawmakers’ choices, "hundreds of thousands of women no longer have access to basic medical care, life-saving cancer screenings and contraception."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: "The median income in America has dropped by 10 percent in the last four years."

description_txt: stated on June 25, 2012 in a speech on the State Senate floor:
quote_txt: "The state's unemployment rate is fifth-highest in the country, a full point above the nationwide rate and higher than all of our...neighboring states."

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2012 in an online blog post:
quote_txt: Obama has "racked up more debt than any president in history — over $5 trillion."

description_txt: stated on May 29, 2012 in a YouTube ad:
quote_txt: U.S. Rep. Phil Gingrey gave the government the power to electronically spy on Americans without a warrant.

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2012 in a campaign press release:
quote_txt: Says, "Yet in Salem they have traditionally waited until the money is almost gone to pay for the most important things in our state’s budget."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2012 in a speech in Orlando:
quote_txt: The DREAM Act "was written by members of both parties. When it came up for a vote a year and a half ago, Republicans in Congress blocked it. The bill hadn’t changed. ... The only thing that had changed was politics."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2012 in a message forwarded to many people:
quote_txt: Says "a lip-reading instructor at the River School, a Washington, D.C., school for the deaf" has determined that during 9/11 ceremonies, Michelle Obama said, "All this for a damn flag."

description_txt: stated on June 19, 2012 in an online ad:
quote_txt: Says Josh Mandel’s campaign is under FBI investigation

description_txt: stated on June 6, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says GOP U.S. Rep. Sean Duffy of Wisconsin "voted twice to end Medicare."

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2012 in an interview on My9 News' “New Jersey Now”:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Chris Christie’s proposed budget is "the biggest spending budget in the history of the state of New Jersey. It is the largest in the nation at this point in time."

description_txt: stated on June 5, 2012 in a floor speech.:
quote_txt: Ronald Reagan "raised taxes in 1982, 1984, 1985, 1986 and 1987."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2012 in a press release:
quote_txt: Atlanta Tea Party co-founder Debbie Dooley "wants gas taxes raised."

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2012 in a speech on the floor of the Rhode Island House (which was transmitted electronically):
quote_txt: "Under current law, if you go on a dating website and you say you're 32 and you're actually 42, you've committed a misdemeanor."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • June 25, 2012

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Federal health care reforms amounted to ‘the government takeover of health care.’

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2012 in a video posted on YouTube:
quote_txt: Says New Jersey’s job growth in May represents "25 percent of all the jobs created in the country."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2012 in prepared remarks at a Congressional field hearing.:
quote_txt: "Three of our cities are among the top five worst cities in the U.S. for asthma."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: Women "earn only 77 cents for every dollar earned by men in the same position."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • June 24, 2012

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2012 in in a tweet, online post:
quote_txt: "Did you know Wisconsin's AFSCME union has lost 50%+ of its members since no longer requiring membership?"

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2012 in a comment on 'Fox News Sunday':
quote_txt: "Gov. Romney was very clear, he would veto the DREAM Act."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2012 in a statement made after he filed for re-election at the N.H. Secretary of State’s office.:
quote_txt: "Now, in the House of Representatives, we have 40 different jobs bills that have passed and almost all of them have been bipartisan."

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2012 in a speech to the Republican Party of Texas convention in Fort Worth.:
quote_txt: Says a national Coca-Cola study showed Texans love Texas more than residents of any other state love their state; Wisconsinites ranked second.
